On the way to the car they dive back to the ground to avoid strafing -- and see their friends lying nearby, in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Rafe jump up and run again.  Anthony, Red, and several other pilots reach the Buick and dive in.  Danny drives away, through the strafing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the Zero pilots see the Buick moving, they go after it. Danny drives like a madman through the strafing, zigzagging and gunning the Buick's V-8.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get me into a plane!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're making a phone call?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) This is Walker!  We're under attack!  Get those planes fueled and armed RIGHT NOW!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got Billy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come with us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are we going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Auxiliary field at Haleiwa, ten miles north of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six P-40's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The number of attacking planes seems endless -- and their strategy flawless.  Torpedoes hitting one ship lifts its hull with a blast, enabling the next wave of torpedoes to rush under and hit the next ship anchored behind.  The American battleships are bobbing like see-saws. The OKLAHOMA takes an entire barrage of torpedoes, blowing thirty foot holes along it's hull; the ship immediately begins to list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doors are wedged shut by the deformation of the structure; vertical ladders are becoming horizontal, and water is pouring in.  Men fight their way up against the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water is up to the trapped sailor's waists when they grab a wrench and start taking turns pounding S.O.S. in Morse code on the bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the listing grows more severe, sailors start jumping from the deck into the water.  Still the Marines on deck are firing back at the planes; some Marines are even using handguns.  But courage does not save them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men still on its deck try to run, but it's not just the fires and the water they can't escape; the gun turrets' 1400 pound shells break loose with the capsizing of the ship and tumble through everything like massive wrecking balls. The sailors and marines, thrown into the water, struggle to get away from the suction as the giant battleship turns turtle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: men are sucked down with amazing force, every hair on their heads streaming behind them as they're snatched to the depths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: everyone and everything is spilling upside down.  The ship's generators sputter out and the lights go out.  The flashlights of the few sailors who can find them cut raggedly through the darkness, and water spills in.  There is no escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Oklahoma's superstructure hits bottom; some men are crushed there.  For others it's salvation, as the BACKWASH blows them toward the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the men are launched almost completely out of the water, before splashing back into the water and burning oil.  A few feet of the steel hull and a portion of the propeller protrude above the surface, but most of the Oklahoma is under water. Men in the water swim toward a medical launch carrying wounded away from the wreckage.  A bomb hits the launch and blows body parts everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In one compartment there are a dozen trapped men.  They've survived the roll-over, and are in a chaotic world where the floor is now the ceiling.  The water is up their waists. Some of the SAILORS are panicking. One sailor has a flashlight and switches it on, flashing the light from face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the water keeps rising, along with their fears.  Several of the sailors are still screaming... The water's already to their bellies.  One of them grabs a wrench and starts slamming Morse code against the bulkhead. One sailor in the middle of the room is particularly panicked, not just yelling but crying and whimpering -- TERRIFIED SAILOR Get me out!  Get me out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at the lower end of the compartment, where the water is deeper -- the ship's nose is lower than her stern.  The water's up to the guy's neck. The man with the flashlight dives down, and finds the guys foot wedged together in the pipes of the ships ceiling -- now their floor. He pops up again.  The water's up to the trapped guy's mouth; he's already gagging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They open it; tools spill out -- among them is a hacksaw. They hand it to him; the sailor dives down and cuts off the guy's foot. The trapped man is underwater, muffling his scream.  He comes free, and surfaces gasping.  His severed foot floats to the surface and then the horror really hits them.  The sailor with the flashlight pops up, in the blossoming of blood.  He and another sailor tie a tourniquet around the stump, to stop the bleeding. The drama of this has caused the other trapped men to stop their signaling.  Now they start banging, twice as loudly as before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't panic!  Don't panic!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ICKED SAILOR The water's rising!  It's coming up, we're all gonna drown!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The air pressure will equalize it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it!  Come on!  Save your air!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a hacksaw in that locker?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Haleiwa is a tiny airfield, tucked among the green volcanic hills; its barely paved, and it's only permanent building is a quonset hut.  A mechanic named EARL, is out with the P-40's; and these are spread out, not bunched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The planes here have received loving care from Earl -- which means lots of cursing; as he's wrestling to load an ammo belt, he yells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Buick, bullet holes punched through the truck, slides to a stop near the planes, and the pilots jump out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What stops him is the cloud of Zeros and dive bombers, shrieking in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guys scatter.  There are sandbags around the hut, and they run there, diving into it's shelter just before the first strafing pass, when a Zero strafes one of the P-40's and a dive bomber blasts another.  Earl stands up in shock and fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny pulls him down, as the Zeros roar overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny, Rafe and Earl run to the planes that got hit and strip out the 20mm cannons and ammo.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sum-bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They ready, Earl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll all fly, but -- oh, shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cover!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You absolute mother-fuckin' son of a bitch!  You shot one of my planes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This ain't a little feud, Earl, it's World War Two!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're coming around for another pass. You got extra weapons and ammo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cock-suckin' right I do!!  In the gun lockers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You guys get those!  Earl, Rafe, come with me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The other pilots run in, throw open the gun locker, and start grabbing weapons -- aircraft machine guns, ammo belts, one even grabs a rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two groups run back and start to set up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny, Rafe and Earl run to a gully opposite the shed and set up there, as the other pilots brace the machine guns against the sandbags. The Japanese planes attacks again.  This time the lead plane hits a wall of steel fired from the combined guns; the bullets chew into the bomb it carries and the plane EXPLODES. The airborne debris makes the following planes shear off. Red's standing, firing; he yells at the Zeros -- RED D-don't like it when we fight back, do ya! Red runs out with his machine gun and keeps firing even when the planes have passed, trying to shoot them right up the ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl shoots a look to Rafe, then turns to Danny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two of the pilots, Joe and Theo, run to Danny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They race toward the planes, and the Japanese attack again. Seeing the pilots running for the P-40's, the Zeros aim for them; Rafe and Danny race for the most distant of the planes; Joe and Theo run for the closer planes, through the dusty bullet hits. Theo makes his plane and is just strapping himself in when bullets stitch his fuselage, wounding him.  He still forces the plane forward.  He taxis twenty feet and his cockpit gets chopped up and the plane arches into a right turn and putters to a stop, Theo dead at the controls. Joe doesn't bother to strap in; he hits the throttle hard and heads down the runway... The Zeros are on him as he gets ten feet of air at 120 M.P.H. The Zero's bullets eat his canopy and plane skin; the plane breaks apart in mid air, spilling in gouts of flame as it smashes down on the tarmac. Rafe and Danny have reaches the more distant P-40's and are revving their engines as they see Joe and Theo's fate.  They throw on their radio headsets. Their way seems blocked:  they've got no runway behind them, the wreckage of four P-40's scattered ahead of them, and the Zeros screaming over the low hills to attack them.  Now Rafe and Danny talk through the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They gun their engines and roll through the grass on either side of the runway, dodging the burning planes; they lift off, clearing the quonset hut by a couple of inches.  They blow right through the strafing fire, and into the sky. Eight Zeros are all over them. Earl is in the hut, on the radio and watching through binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's swiveling in his seat, looking left, right, back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny understands immediately, following Rafe's tactic as he breaks into a sharp turn and uses the hut, palm trees, and low hills to shake the Japs.  They fly like crop dusters, skimming down a foot from the ground, then bobbing up, banking left and right.  The Zeros have divided into two groups to chase them, their wings clipping tree tops as they try to follow the Americans. It feels like a 200 M.P.H. car chase, 20 feet off the ground, Rafe and Danny skimming and bobbing over the terrain, but there are too many Japanese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny banks in one direction, Rafe in another...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Danny, over there!  We're in a canyon, they'll come straight down it, we'll get 'em in a crossfire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Earl!  You said the planes were ready but -- but what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of the four left, only one is full of fuel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will the others get into the air?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Danny, I don't like this fuckin' guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anthony, Red, stay with the guns!  Coma, you cover the cannons!  Joe, Theo, come with us!  Earl, you get on the radio! We're gonna fight these fuckers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do we do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your call, Rafe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get rolling as fast as you can.  Stay low!  We'll use the topography to separate them and then we can take 'em one on one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's tight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tighter 'n a bulls ass in fly season. Don't hit the barn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see six...seven...eight of the cocksuckers!  Don't let 'em hurt my planes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're all over us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bet they don't dust crops in Japan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Danny!  Let's play some chicken!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two P-40's are screaming, rushing at each other like they did at the training base back in the states, flying right into each other's propellers; the Japanese heading after them realize they're rushing headlong at the other group...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't even watch. At the last instant Rafe and Danny snap a quarter spin so the planes flash by belly to belly. Two of the Zeros collide in mid-air, exploding, as the other Zeros scatter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh shit, oh shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Danny and Rafe rejoin each other in the open sky; they've lost the Zeros.  The P-40's are flying smoothly, side by side.  The two pilots look across at each other, going into battle together.  They speak through their radios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fires a short burst to see if his guns work; they do. Rafe does the same.  Up ahead they see a formation of Japanese planes, headed toward Pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look across at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Side by side the P-40's scream in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You hear my okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.  So you can call me if you need help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a half a tank.  You?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Little less.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're in strafing formation, we'll blow right through their line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Land of the free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Home of the brave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Japanese planes are in tight, disciplined formation, their minds on the targets below them in the harbor.  But their day of shooting sitting ducks changes as the two P-40's blast in, wing guns blazing, chopping into Two Zeros.  Both Zeros falter and begin to lose altitude.  The P-40's make almost impossible tight turns, still side-by-side, and go after the two plane they crippled on the first pass. Rafe finishes one Zero, making it explode in a ball of flame in the air.  Danny finishes the other, shooting off its wing so that it spirals into the sea and crashes there. The P-40's swoop up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The P-40's dig in again, swooping down on the line of Zeros. Rafe hits first, machine gunning one plane, and Danny comes in behind it, finishing it off. The Japanese pilots are screaming at each other over their radios, but their SQUADRON COMMANDER sees Pearl Harbor ahead, and tells them -- JAPANESE SQUADRON COMMANDER Hold the line! The P-40's come through again, their guns spitting fire.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're trying to hold formation.  We can chew 'em up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: These planes are different -- high altitude bombers with three-man crews, high above the harbor.  The bombardier looks through his sight and the bomb bays open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the ships look like tops, far below.  The bombardier is ticking off the targets as they pass, the first two he mentions already burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flips his bomb switch, and a HUGE STEEL BOMB falls away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: West Virginia... Oklahoma... Ah, Arizona.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We stay with the bomb as it falls through the sky.  The small propeller on the bomb's nose spins in the air, running the arming mechanism into the bomb's explosive core.  The bomb wobbles a bit at first, but then as it gathers speed its fins stabilize it, and it falls faster and faster, at a dizzying rate, toward the Arizona. It slams through the teak wood deck, and breaks it like matchsticks. It's tremendous weight and speed carry it through the next deck, and the next, deep into the heart of the ship...toward the powder room, where two million pounds of black powder are waiting. The bomb hits there, and the explosion is almost beyond comprehension.  Over 1400 men die instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The battleship Arizona leaps into the air, the ship's spine is broken, it's guts ripped open in one explosive instant. Men on the deck are thrown into the burning oil already floating on the water from the other ruptured ships, but there are almost no survivors. The concussion of the explosion blows men off the repair ship Vestal, next to the Arizona, saving Vestal, as the explosion snuffs out the fires on Vestal; it also sends tons of debris down on her decks -- parts of the ship, legs, arms and heads of men, all sorts of bodies. Debris from the Arizona also cover the Tennessee and does more damage than the two Japanese bombs that hit her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medics have already started bringing in the wounded.  Evelyn is like a frantic traffic cop.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Put criticals in ward one, stables in two!  Barbara!  Fill every syringe you can find with stimulant and antibiotic -- MEDIC Where are the doctors?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the third tee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Evelyn!  Where's the morphine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evelyn runs in, snaps open the cabinet, grabs a bag of morphine sticks, and is about to run out again when she sees the Arizona go up. For a moment she's frozen, then she actually sees the shock wave traveling across the bay and through the trees like an invisible wall.  She's trying to cross her arms over her face, and dive to the floor, just as the windows blow out from the concussion, and glass flies over everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They see the results of their bomb, and are ecstatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nose of Danny's plane is pointed right at the harbor and he sees the sudden devastation of the Arizona.  It is a sight so awesome it freezes him for a moment. A Zero comes up behind him, firing.  Danny jerks his stick to maneuver but he's caught... Rafe comes in behind the Zero, chopping it up, even as he yells at Danny over the radio -- RAFE Ain't no time for spectatin'! They turn back after the line of Zeros.  There are some Japanese planes coming after them now, but the P-40's head at their noses, firing, then duck past in a double maneuver, and turn right back into the Japanese formation. Rafe has a plane in his sights, but his guns fire only a short burst before stopping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They head back.  A single Zero is on their way.  Rafe charges it and draws its fire; Danny comes in behind the Zero and rakes its cockpit; the Japanese pilot backs off. The P-40's dive back toward Haleiwa. A handful of Zeros returning from Pearl see them and follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm out of ammo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm out of fuel!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The second wave of planes takes off from the carriers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Genda reports to Yamamoto.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Second attack wave is in the air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The DISC JOCKEY, handed a message by the army officer, stops playing the soothing Hawaiian music and announces...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All Army, Navy, and Marine personnel to report to duty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: General SHORT is in his office; he and his aides are working frantically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mobilize everything!  We're at war!  Send a message to Washington:  Hostilities with Japan commenced with an air raid on Pearl Harbor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: President Roosevelt is having lunch in the Oval Room study with Harry Hopkins.  The phone RINGS and Hopkins answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He listens, then puts the receiver down, shaken.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oval Room... Yes, he is. (to Roosevelt) It's Knox, Mr. President.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking phone) Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Japanese have attacked Pearl Harbor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My God.  Do we have damage estimates?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our Pacific Fleet, at anchor, unprepared? It's terrible.  It has to be.  And it's not over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two P-40's drop out of the sky and bounce to a landing; Anthony and Red have been pushing the wreckage off the field with the Buick.  Danny and Rafe pull the P-40's behind the burning quonset hut, and it's like a pit stop at a race track; Earl rushes up and starts fueling the planes, their engines still running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl shouts instructions to the pilots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other pilots race to the wrecked P-40's and start pulling out ammo belts.  Earl glares at the smoking engine of Danny's plane, and the bullet holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl looks at Rafe's plane, more shot-up and abused than Danny's.  Rafe grins and waves to him.  Earl mumbles a stream of guttural and unintelligible obscenities. The Zeros that followed them sweep down, strafing.  One mechanic, running across the field with a belt of ammo, goes down.  Coma, running behind him, picks up the fallen man's ammo and his own, bringing both to the planes behind the hut. He, Red, and Anthony reload the machine guns in Rafe and Danny's planes. Rafe and Danny gun their engines and head back into the air, the grounded pilots firing a covering barrage and Earl even coming up with a 12-gauge shotgun to fire at the Zeros as they rush past.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We need ammo too!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Strip it from the wrecks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who the fuck taught you to fly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Second Wave of Japanese planes is in tight formation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lt. Commander SHIMAZAKI, leader of the second attack wave, says calmly into his radio...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads the second wave in on their attack run...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Second wave, deploy over the military bases.  High level bombers to the air stations, dive bombers attack ships in harbor.  Fighters strafe and cover.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The navy's planes, bunched up on the naval airfield, are destroyed without ever getting into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The harbor is already a mass of destruction and panic; screaming everywhere, men trying to fight fires, move the wounded; the second wave of planes hits, and tremendous explosions now rock the secondary ships like the destroyer
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN THE CHAOS ON THE SHIPS,

direction.raw_text: blasting it apart. But the Japanese pilots are now having trouble with the thick black smoke coming out of the damaged ships, and off the oil fires along the water.  One torpedo plane, its pilot flying blind, clips the superstructure of a battleship and spins to a crash. Still, even IN THE CHAOS ON THE SHIPS, the sailors struggle to survive, inventively.  Men trapped on one burning ship use the severed barrel of a five-inch naval gun as a bridge to cross to the less damaged ship anchored beside them. Others jump into the water and swim through the burning oil, towing buddies too wounded to swim themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below decks, sailors have organized a line and are passing ammunition from the ammo lockers, hand to hand up to the guns on deck.  Blasts from bombs hit them and ignite the ammo they're holding, setting off a chain reaction of explosions. On the deck, the sailors are out of ammo.  An OFFICER grabs a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The young sailor jumps to a dinghy and launches it through the oily waters and thick black smoke.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Grab a dinghy and get ammo from the base ammo storeroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sailors in the boat get strafed, the rounds cutting between them and blasting their boat in two.  They jump into the oily water and swim toward shore. Other sailors are in the water with them, struggling, swallowing the vile black liquid as they battle to swim. Errant bombs and shrapnel hit beside them, killing some; other lose strength and slide beneath the surface. The sailors from the ammo boat make it ashore; it's hot there too, with bullets and bombs all around.  One sailor has to stop and puke from the oil; his buddy grabs him and they run for cover; they find it in the dugout of the baseball diamond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads men in a race through strafing fire to the bases ammo storeroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SUPPLY SERGEANT is at his post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pushes the man out of the way and starts grabbing weapons.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We need weapons and ammo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need authorization.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The fuck I do!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gunnery sergeant and his marines run with a water-cooled machine gun, across the open ground, under fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Marines set up in the windows of their already-strafed barracks, and start firing there, as the Zeros scream past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trucks are moving dependents -- women and children -- from the dependents' housing area.  The Japanese strafe the trucks, dependents diving for cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fire engine from the Honolulu Fire Department races up to the sight of buildings burning from the air attack.  As the firemen jump out, a Zero strafes them, gunning down the firemen. As the strafing Zero starts to bank away, two P-40's come in behind it, both of them gunning away.  The Zero comes apart under the barrage, and crashes in a ball of flame. It's Rafe and Danny, back in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The once-pristine hospital with its glowing white beds is now a bloody chaos.  Every bed is already full; there are burned and broken people on the floor -- soldiers, sailors, civilians, firemen, all mixed in together.  People are dying everywhere, and screaming in pain, or moaning and begging for help.  At first we don't see Evelyn, and wonder if she survived the glass; then we see her, flecks of her own blood dotting her face and arms.  The blood of soldiers on her surgical apron.  A steel calm has replaced her earlier frenzy, even as the other nurses are breaking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young doctor is trying to give an intravenous injection to a man who's badly charred; the doctors hands are shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctors are amputating limbs right there in the hallway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't tell who's gotten morphine and who hasn't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take a grease pencil and mark an M on the forehead of everyone you stick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't look for a vein, just poke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My pen's dry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Use lipstick.  Use ammo belts for tourniquets, use your own nylons if you have to!  Barbara!  Grab anything that will hold a pint of blood and sterilize it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: calls -- SENIOR DOCTOR Evelyn!  You have to do the triage! They're bringing them in with trucks! Evelyn moves to the door.  Trucks are pulling up, loaded with the wounded, young terrified soldiers bringing them inside; Evelyn does quick triage as they pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next body through is a pilot, wings on his uniform, his chest riddled with bullets -- and his face shot off.  For a moment Evelyn falters, then she forces herself to check the dog tags... It isn't Rafe or Danny.  Evelyn sags in guilty relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She steadies herself as the next body comes through, a woman on a stretcher, her stomach shot open, pale hands clutching at the open wound.  Evelyn feels for a pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Betty. And though the bombs are blasting and guns booming everywhere, the world goes silent for Evelyn. One of the sailors outside the door is pointing to the harbor, the Nevada has begun to move.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Critical -- front ward!... Give him morphine, he can't wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take him outside and cover him; he's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's gone too, take her --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The battleship NEVADA is underway, plowing through the harbor, as the water erupts with bombs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain is struggling to save his ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We can save her if we make the open sea!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: THE ATTACKING PLANES - DAY The lead pilot in the next squad of Japanese planes spots the moving battleship, and leads his squadron on it. They come whipping in over the waves, dropping torpedoes and bombs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Nevada's Captain feels the ship shudder as it takes hits amidships.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His officers relay the order to the helm, and the ship's rudder turns as more blasts rip her hull.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're not gonna make it -- and if we go down here we block the channel... Beach her, there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Nevada swings off its course and runs aground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The impact jolts the boilers, already bursting with the steam pressure; gouts of steam from rupturing pipes scalds and blinds the engine room crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Nevada, run aground at the shoreline, is now like a beast cut from the herd; the predators swarm after it with torpedoes and bombs. One torpedo, missing the Nevada, skims right up the beach itself and blasts a house on the shore to fragments. Bombs detonate along the Nevada, engulfing the entire upper deck in flames, ravaging the sailors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Nevada is grounded near the hospital; from the doorway Evelyn can see the whole ship on fire, burning sailors leaping off the decks.  Her hearing, her presence of mind, returns; she lets Betty go, and grabs an ORDERLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The orderly races away.  They can still hear the bombs falling outside. A sailor staggers toward the hospital from the Nevada.  He is completely gray.  Everyone stares at him, and then realizes he is nude, burned gray, his skin ash. Evelyn rushes to help him, shouting back over her shoulder to the other nurses -- EVELYN We're gonna need every bed.  If they can breathe, make 'em get up and move someplace else!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go to the base hardware store and get some of those canister spray things they use for killing bugs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Insecticide?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, just the sprayers.  We'll fill them with tannic acid, it'll sterilize them and cool the burns!  GO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The first wave of planes lands on the carrier.  The flight leader rushes to the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yamamoto's advisors are exultant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yamamoto nods and Fuchida's voice comes over the intercom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have achieved complete surprise!  The first wave is returning, the second is attacking now, and we have lost only a few planes.  We can launch a third wave, Admiral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The second wave has not returned.  And we have no idea where their carriers are. What is the damage report?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have Commander Fuchida on the radio now, Admiral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am over the harbor now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fuchida is in a scout plane, high over Pearl.  His vision is hampered by the thick black smoke, but he can tell there has been awesome devastation.  He uses a diagram of the ships at anchor to note the damage to each ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) We have a tremendous victory.  Many ships damaged, some totally destroyed.  But the Second Wave's attack is being hindered by the smoke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The more we attack, the harder it is to find targets.  And we no longer have surprise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If we launch the third wave and annihilate their fuel depots, we destroy their ability to operate in the Pacific for at least a year!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if we fail, and lose our carriers, we destroy our ability to fight them at all. (beat) As soon as the second wave returns, we will withdraw.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The last planes touch down, and the lead carrier and the other ships in the Japanese assault fleet turn back toward home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The harbor is a place of shattered bodies and shattered ships.  Blood, body parts, debris everywhere, and all of it made more hellish by the oil fires on the water and the choking black smoke those fires produce. Every survivor has become an emergency fireman, stretcher bearer, medic, iron worker.  They fish men from the water, extract them from the tangled wreckage of the ships. Everyone is screaming and yelling -- the wounded for help, the helpers for more help. Local firemen and civilians battle heroically too; the water mains are ruptured, so they put pump water from the base swimming pool toward the burning ships. The PHOTOGRAPHER records this with his black-and-white film camera.  He is shaken, and yet he understands the magnitude of what he is recording -- the loss of America's innocence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In one place, outside a barracks, soldiers hit by the bombs are just becoming conscious.  One of them comes to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's crawling around toward the bushes; his legs are shattered, but he's spotted a body.  He reaches it, turns it over -- and it's headless. He turns away in horror...and finds himself staring at the severed head. The medics appear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sarge?!  Where are you, Sarge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got two more over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Western Union messenger, Tadao Fuchikami, delivers the telegram from Washington.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Short and his staff are assessing damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An aide hands Short the telegram.  He reads it -- SHORT From Washington.  "Intelligence reports an ultimatum from Japan to be given precisely at one p.m.  Washington time. Just what significance the hour set may have we do not know, but be on alert accordingly." The irony is bitter in his throat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want lookouts and sentries everywhere, with orders to shoot first and ask questions later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think an invasion possible, General?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: After this morning, we better not consider anything impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Honolulu police roar up to the embassy in squad cars, and burst through the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police storm through the embassy and find the Japanese there burning documents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Divers are going down, trying to save the trapped men.  But the tangle of the Arizona is horrific.  One diver gets trapped, and another tries to extricate him, and the steel shifts and falls on them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a naval CAPTAIN oversees rescue efforts.  The 17-year-old sailor he sent off for ammo now approaches him, with great concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The captain looks out over the wreckage, great battleships devastated in every direction.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ON THE DECK OF BOMB-SHATTERED BATTLESHIP,

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I...I lost the dinghy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, son, we won't worry about the dinghy today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Danny and Rafe arrive at the hospital.  Their fears of what they might find aren't helped when they see the stairs into the hospital covered in blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny enter.  It's a scene from hell.  Doctors are doing amputations in the hallway.  The once-pristine hospital is now all red, with blood dripping through the mattresses, onto the floor... In the main ward, Evelyn and the other nurses are using the fly sprayers to spritz cooling antiseptic on the charred bodies.  Evelyn looks up and sees both Rafe and Danny.  Her eyes register relief, but they are the only part of her that can show emotion now; the rest of her is covered in blood. Rafe and Danny move to her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How can we help?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny sit quietly as Evelyn adjusts the tubes conducting blood from their arms into sterilized Coke bottles for transfusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops, afraid if she says more, she'll lose grip on her emotions.  She can see the wreckage out in the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes back to her work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What else can we do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing you can do here, they'll die or they won't, we just --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a sailor, a black man on the West Virginia, named Dorie Miller.  I'd like to know if he's alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny hop from the ambulance in which they've hitched a ride to the harbor.  They see the awful devastation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny reach the West Virginia's pier, but in the darkness, they can't find anything.  They stop a NAVAL OFFICER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points; the battleship has sunk, its superstructure barely showing above the water. It looks hopeless to find a single sailor here; but then they see a powerful black sailor, pulling to the dock with a dinghy full of dead men retrieved from the water.  As workers unload the bodies, the black sailor sits down, exhausted physically and emotionally, his head in his hands.  Rafe and Danny approach him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miller nods, and looks out over the harbor, a hellish place where black smoke still hangs over everything, the shattered remains of men and ships still in the harbor.  It's total devastation.  And yet something about that scene stirs something else in Dorie Miller.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where is the West Virginia?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're looking for Dorie Miller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's me, Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A friend of ours wanted to be sure you're alive.  Evelyn.  A nurse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like we all are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's something out there I need to get.  Will you help me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dorie pilots the dinghy through the floating debris.  Rafe and Danny sit with him.  He stops over a dangerous pile of superstructure wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny brace the dinghy so it doesn't move; but they still don't see what Dorie is after as he fishes down in the water, for something barely at the surface; he works for a moment, then pulls it up. It's the oil-soaked flag of the Arizona.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Arizona.  Hold the dinghy steady, so it doesn't bust open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Men are working through the night to save the sailors trapped in the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are in total darkness.  From it we hear GASPING, then -- SAILOR What's that? The light comes on and sweeps around the faces.  The water is up to their chests, but it's stopped rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He switches the light off again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just hand on.  They'll find us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because we would find them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The welders are cutting away, the torches sending showers of sparks everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are gasping, running out of air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something stirs in the ship; a noise...from where?  Then a point of light; sparks fly into the room; somebody's cutting through the wall.  And the sparks illuminate faces suddenly filled with hope. But as the cut enlarges, the trapped air, compressed by the water, starts rushing out -- and the water starts rising again.  The trapped sailors hope turns to terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The steel circle pops out, and they knock the welders down in their hurry to escape. Some of the sailors who were trapped are naked.  They fight their way toward the escape hole cut into the hull, assisted by rescue workers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Breathe easy.  Stay calm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You hear something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's letting out air, and letting in water!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The trapped sailors emerge, and they can barely take in the devastation.  Destroyed ships everywhere, the smoking wreckage... The rescued sailors gaze around them in shock. They are shivering, and other sailors put blankets around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire Washington press corps is waiting, with fresh bulbs in the flash attachments of cameras that are already as big as a shoe box.  The President is wheeled out of the White House, and not a single photographer takes a picture...not yet. Aides help Roosevelt from the chair, and the press people all see the President struggle on legs that have no strength, to the podium.  His aides lock the steel clasps at the knees of his braces into place, and the President stands at the microphone.  And suddenly, from the front, Roosevelt looks powerful, even majestic. Now all the bulbs pop and flash.  He looks into the cameras.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yesterday, December 7, 1941 -- a date which will live in infamy -- the United States of American was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: we see the bombing, the aftermath, the bodies being fished from the oil-soaked harbor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The distance of Hawaii from Japan makes it obvious that the attacks was planned many days or even weeks ago.  During the intervening time the Japanese Government has deliberately sought to deceive the United States by false statements and expressions of hope for continued peace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Japanese fleet steams back toward Japan.  The young officers are exultant...but Yamamoto is pensive.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...I regret to tell you that many American lives have been lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see rows of bodies outside the hospital where Evelyn works. The mess hall has been converted to a silent morgue, with bodies on every table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yesterday the Japanese Government also launched an attack against Malaya.  Last night Japanese forces attacked Hong Kong... Guam...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  ISLANDS - NIGHT We see Japanese planes bombing islands, and soldiers attacking amphibious landings.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...the Philippine Islands... Wake Island... And this morning the Japanese attacked Midway Island.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The facts speak for themselves.  With confidence in our armed forces -- with the unbounding determination of our people -- we will gain the inevitable triumph -- so help us God.  I ask that the Congress declare that since the unprovoked and dastardly attack by Japan on Sunday, December 7, 1941, a state of war -- The words echoes out across America -- ROOSEVELT'S VOICE War...war...war... It rings through the radios of farm houses, to country boys gathered round; in the pool halls of big cities; in the fire houses and high schools...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all across America -- men line up faster than the recruiters can handle them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt meets with his advisors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt places his hands on the arms of his wheelchair, and struggles to lift himself.  Aides jump to help him, but he waves them off.  With inhuman physical effort, that has his neck veins bulging and sweat popping on his face, Roosevelt stands on his withered legs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, the crisis we face is not the fact that our enemies believe they can defeat us -- it's the fact that our people believe it too.  I want a plan -- a workable plan -- to hit the heart of Japan, to bomb them the way they have bombed us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. President, Pearl Harbor caught us because we didn't face facts.  This isn't a time for ignoring them again.  There are no planes in the entire American arsenal capable of covering the distance to Japan from any land base we control while carrying enough bombs to do any damage whatsoever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right, Mr. President.  The Army has long range bombers, but no place to launch them from.  Midway's too far, China is overrun by Japanese forces, and Russia refuses to go to war with Japan and won't allow us to launch a raid from there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The navy's planes are small, carry light loads, and have short range.  We would have to get them within a few hundred miles of Japan, and therefore risk our carriers.  And if we lose our carriers, we have no shield against invasion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if the Japanese did invade?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've done studies.  We're confident we would turn them back eventually...after they'd gotten as far as Chicago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. President...with all respect...what you are asking can't be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do not tell me...it can't be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is a mass memorial service going on, with caskets draped in flags. There are also coffins covered in Japanese flags, their drowned fliers being treated now with respect. Everyone is in their best uniforms.  The pilots -- Rafe, Danny, and the other guys -- are looking at Billy's coffin; Evelyn, next to Danny, on his appropriate side is looking at one that belongs to Betty.  So is Red; he's grieving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Evelyn exchange a glance, past Danny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the mourners disperse, Evelyn puts a lei on Betty's casket; Red does the same, then breaks down beside Danny.  As Danny comforts him, Evelyn moves to Rafe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An Army Corps MAJOR steps up and interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny sees him and moves up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands them both orders.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Where is God in this?  Our enemies believe a divine wind protects them.  We see our friends laid out before us, and find it hard to believe in anything at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Though we cannot understand why our friends should die while we live, we can affirm our truest selves in our belief that any God worth divinity would choose both justice and mercy, and would take these fallen brothers and sisters into eternal peace.  Amen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rafe -- RAFE I need to tell you something.  I didn't know what it was to lose somebody, to see death and find how much it scares you. That you haven't lived and loved enough. I didn't understand.  Forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rafe... No.  You forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course I forgive you.  I know what you feel for Danny is real.  And your choice is your choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I have to tell you, Rafe.  It wasn't a choice.  It --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant Rafe McCawley?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Major.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant Daniel Walker here too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Walker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going Stateside.  We fly out in half an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for, Sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask Colonel Doolittle.  Those orders are from him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The wrecked planes have been pushed off the runway and lie in piles.  A transport plane is fueling, and Rafe and Danny wait in the shade of a shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Major, watching the fueling, gets a wave from the ground crew and turns and motions to Rafe and Danny that they're ready.  They pick up their duffel bags -- and then Evelyn comes around the corner of the shelter. Rafe sees her first, but stops and looks away as Danny moves to her.  For a moment he studies her eyes, and she does not look away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes her into his arms, kisses her tenderly but briefly, a final time.  Evelyn's eyes find Rafe, but he can't look at her until the embrace is over. Rafe and Danny move to the plane and hurry up the steps. They turn before the door closes and wave to her. Evelyn's still standing there as the plane lifts away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I told her not to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This hasn't been easy for any of us.  I feel awful for how it's happened.  But I've seen my first spring too.  Thanks for knowing that's true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S. MILITARY INSTALLATION - NIGHT The transport has landed and taxied right to the door of a low, dark bunker, mostly underground.  The Major leads Rafe and Danny inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny follow the Major down a spartan corridor; the whole place reeks of secrecy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Major opens the door for Rafe and Danny, then leaves, closing it behind him.  Doolittle is alone at a desk.  Rafe and Danny walk in and salute.  Doolittle motions to the two chairs in front of the desk without looking up from the papers he's studying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle looks up from his paperwork for the first time. His eyes are fierce.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I heard what you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can explain, Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Explain what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever is was you heard about us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean the hula shirts you were flying in?... Or the six planes you shot down? You're both being awarded the Silver Star, and promoted to captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that the good new, Sir, or -- DOOLITTLE You're just about the only pilots in the Army with actual combat experience, so you're volunteering for a mission I've been ordered to put together.  Do you know what top secret is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well sure, Colonel -- DOOLITTLE Top secret means you help me pick the other pilots, train, and go -- without knowing where you're going until it's too late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can count on us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's only one other thing I can tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You won't need any goddamn hula shirts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  ESTABLISHING EGLIN FIELD, FLORIDA - DAY Eglin Field is on the gulf coast of Florida.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A room full of PILOTS are assembled, with and other CREWMEN. Danny and Rafe are there; Red and Anthony too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel Doolittle strides into the room as all the men snap to attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny and Rafe whisper to each other -- DANNY Sorry you're gonna die -- cause I'm gonna make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe elbows his ribs so hard it takes his breath away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Attention!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be seated.  The mission you've volunteered for is dangerous.  How dangerous?  Look at the man beside you. It's a good bet that six weeks from now, either you or he will be dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What color flowers you want me to bring to your funeral?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In flight school you qualified in single and in multi-engine planes.  You'll be flying multi-engines here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Bombers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to introduce a couple of people. Doc White is a flight surgeon; he has volunteered for gunnery training so that he can go on the mission, because we can't spare the weight of an extra man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) A long range bomber mission.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...And Ross Greening, who will oversee your equipment.  Any questions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who'll be the first one in, Colonel?  I'd like to volunt --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought I'd made it clear, I'm not just putting this mission together -- I'm leading it myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take it back, about the flowers.  We're all gonna die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bomber, from different angles. The pilots look them over, liking what they see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look down the runway a few hundred feet.  A private waves, and starts painting a red line across the runway. Another private, close by, paints a green line.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is what we'll fly -- the B-25. There's one thing you have to be aware of from the very beginning.  You see that private?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Green means go.  Red means dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - EGLIN FIELD - DAY The pilots practice takeoff's.  Red is Rafe's copilot; Anthony is Danny's.  Nobody can get airborne before the red line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle is instructing the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe is distracted; he's lost in though, looking at Danny -- and looks away just before Danny realizes it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're having trouble getting airborne in the shorter space because you're not revving the engines enough.  You've got to push them to the limit before you ever start to move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - EXT.  EGLIN FIELD RUNWAY - DAY Pilots practice hard, revving the engines, taking off hard...all of them crossing the red line, takeoff after takeoff.  Rafe pushes his engine hard and still crosses by twenty feet; Danny pushes even harder, and misses by ten feet. Doolittle watches with Greening from the edge of the runway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to get the weight down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Greening has removed the intensely complex Norden sight from a bomber and put in on a table for Doolittle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shows Doolittle an aluminum strip on a swivel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, forty pounds gone.  And in it's place, this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Weight, 3 ounces.  Cost, 20 cents.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doolittle pilots a B-25 at treetop level onto a practice bombing range.  Greening uses the makeshift sight, and drops a 500-lb sack of flour, right in the middle of the bull's-eye target chalked on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The B-25's are practicing, flying at treetop level.  Red is Rafe's copilot, Anthony is Danny's.  Doolittle is flying the lead bomber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe brings his plane down, smoothly.  Then Danny's plane appears -- under him.  Rafe jerks his nose up quickly. Rafe's angry; Danny's laughing -- but he scares the shit out of his crew.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Right down to the treetops.  Low as you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Danny's outside, looking up at the moon.  Rafe appears and moves up beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's anger flares for a moment -- but Rafe's hit home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's caught off-guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They embrace, closer now than ever.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fun today.  Like old times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Danny, what the hell are you trying to do out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?  I'm just doing what we've always done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  You're trying to beat me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've always tried to beat each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit.  We've played with each other, pushed each other.  This is different. Like you want to prove that you're better than me.  Who's that for -- Evelyn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe just trying to measure up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's between you and her is between you and her.  But here's what's between you and me.  Everybody has a hero, Danny. And you're mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When we were growing up, I had everything.  You had nothing.  You climbed out of a hole I couldn't even see the bottom of.  I think maybe when I went off to England, I was trying to measure up to you.  Measuring up's over.  Let's just look out for each other.  Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: with the planes practicing their short takeoffs, we see Roosevelt in one of his fireside chats, his voice broadcast across America...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Families all across America are gathered around radios, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The FAMILIES do, gathering around encyclopedias, school books, any reference they have, spread on kitchen tables, suburban living room rugs, or farmhouse hearths... And the B-25's, all sixteen of them, begin a journey in formation, flying at treetop level across America: Mississippi delta land, Texas plains, Arizona mesas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The formation of B-25's reaches San Francisco.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, America...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm told that 80% of American families are listening to these fireside chats of ours, and I'm happy we can come together, as one great American family.  I'd like each of you within the sound of my voice to find a map...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at the Pacific Ocean.  It covers half the surface of the earth.  And look at the great Atlantic.  The oceans both divide and connect us to our enemies, and either they will come to us, or we will go to them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doolittle leads the bombers to a landing.  IN RAFE'S PLANE, everybody's wondering why they're here.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: N-naval station?  What's g-going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wish I knew, Red.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The crews climb from their planes, and almost before they're out, teams of men use straps and cranes to hoist the bombers onto flatbed trucks.  Doolittle walks up to Rafe and Danny, watching the baffling operation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Want to see where they're going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cranes lift the planes from the trucks and hoist them onto the flight decks of the carrier USS HORNET.  The pilots stand on the pier, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all gather around Doolittle as he moves up to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle walks to join a captain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I guess that settles it.  Somewhere in the Pacific.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With a s-short r-runway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have rooms at the Biltmore.  I suggest a nice meal and a good night's sleep.  We leave tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  SAN FRANCISCO HOTEL - NIGHT The pilots get off the bus and carry their duffels into the lobby.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: San Francisco, here we are!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) I don't reckon we can get hogbrains and grits, but I hear a man can eat good in this town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna turn in.  I hate being on the water.  I think this is the last sleep I'll get for awhile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The other guys drop their duffels with the bell hops; Rafe moves to the reception desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The manager hands him a key, and smiles curiously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: McCawley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe enters his room and finds the light on...and Evelyn's there waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood drains from Rafe's heart.  Yet he finds the strength to move to her.  She turns away, so she won't throw her arms around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her head, refuses to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and faces him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him, her eyes bright with tears, but still she refuses to cry.  They both know they can't touch, or they'll never let go.  She walks past him, out of the room, closing the door softly behind her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were bringing back a ship full of wounded and needed extra nurses along.  I wrote Colonel Doolittle, and told him I needed to see you before you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It must of been a convincing letter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was.  I couldn't have you go away, wherever it is...to war...without knowing something.  You think I made a choice, of Danny over you.  I didn't.  I didn't have a choice.  I'm pregnant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does Danny know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't sure, until the day you turned up alive.  I never had a chance to tell him.  Now I can't have him thinking about this when he needs to be thinking about his mission, and how to come back from it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want you thinking about that too.  Just come back. (beat) Rafe, I see it in your face.  You're thinking you don't have anything to live for.  Don't you dare think that way. I'll never write a letter, or look at a sunset, without thinking of you.  I'll love you my whole life.  And I want you to live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The USS HORNET clears the Golden Gate Bridge, with cruisers and destroyers rounding out its battle group. Rafe and Danny stand on the flight deck, watching the city recede behind them. Evelyn is on a hilltop watching them go.  Danny can't see her, doesn't know she's there.  Rafe can't see her either -- but he knows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Army pilots to the briefing room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The pilots are gathered expectantly in the carrier's conference room.  Doolittle strides in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pilots love it.  The ones who have not seen battle are grinning and vocal.  Rafe, Danny, Anthony, and Red are quieter, savoring the prospect of revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the pilots don't like the sound of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolute silence among the pilots.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, I can now tell you that the target of this mission is Tokyo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And where's the secret base, Sir?  The one we t-takeoff from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The navy will get us to within 400 miles of the Japanese coast.  We'll launch off the carriers from there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, has this ever been done, launching an army bomber off a navy carrier?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  Any other questions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C-Colonel, we been p-practicing takeoff's, but I ain't sure we can land on these carriers d-decks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We won't have the fuel to get back to the carriers; they'll turn and run back to Hawaii the minute we're airborne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then wh-where do we land?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a phrase I want you all to memorize:  "Lushu hoo megwa fugi."  It means "I am an American."  In Chinese.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sailors who man the flight deck look at each other with bafflement as the worried pilots pace from one end of the deck to the other.  They're in a line like ducks, Rafe in the lead and the others following, counting steps, each man measuring the distance.  Shaking their heads, worrying. They stop at the end and look down at the sea far below them; it's dizzying.  Anthony shoves Red for fun before grabbing his shoulder to stop him from falling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts pacing back the other way, as if the ship's longer in that direction.  The other pilots watch him for a moment, then follow him, counting again. Rafe and Danny are left standing alone at the end of the flight deck.  Far over the surging sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle appears right beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A-a-asshole!... Maybe it's l-longer going this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's shorter than our practice runway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll turn the ship into the wind before we launch.  That'll help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll be loaded with 2,000 pounds of bombs and 1,500 pounds of fuel.  I got another Chinese phrase for Doolittle. "Mug wump rickshaw mushu pork."  It means "Who the fuck thought up this shit?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was a navy man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we'll be lucky with the weather.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Hornet tosses, bashed by a vicious storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ships is rolling; most of the fliers are green. Doolittle stands at the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at a pile of paper slips in front of him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Since we'll be on our own once we're in the air, I thought I had a good idea letting each crew select it's own target.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now we have fifteen requests for the Emperor's Palace...and one for Tokyo baseball stadium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I d-don't think Japs ought'a be allowed to p-play baseball.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to bomb their Emperor too.  But I think that'd just piss 'em off.  The idea here, Gentlemen, is not revenge. We're here to prove to them that they're neither invincible nor superior.  So let's try this again.  Military targets only.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colonel, to f-fight you need strategy. To have strategy, ya gotta practice.  And to practice it, ya gotta play -- DOOLITTLE No baseball diamonds, Red.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Y-Yes Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The storm is subsiding, but it's still raining.  From the bridge of the Hornet, they spot the ENTERPRISE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Enterprise will ride shotgun when we launch the bombers.  They wanted our carriers at Pearl, and now we've come to them.  If the Japanese get us, they'll be having dinner in San Francisco next month.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The preparations begin.  Deck crews move the B-25's to the rear of the flight deck.  Fueling teams top off the bomber's gas tanks.  Ordnance men hoist four bombs into each aircraft, and the army gunners load ammunition for the machine guns. Greening checks the planes' mechanical and hydraulic systems. And once again the pilots are out pacing the deck distance. It's turned into a game for them, walking off nerves.  As Rafe and Danny pass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's not getting any longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Longer?  It's getting shorter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doolittle is laying out the plan for all the pilots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle looks around the room.  No one's smiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We'll take off late this afternoon.  I'll hit Tokyo at dusk, and drop incendiary bombs.  You'll come after me at night, guided by the fires.  Then it's on to China, where you'll arrive at dawn, guided to their airfields by the homing beacons the Chinese are going to switch on for us.  That's if everything is perfect -- like every other military mission I've ever been involved with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen you guys.  I'm the first plane -- then McCawley, Walker, the rest of you. I'll have the shortest run.  If I don't make it, you don't go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colonel...we're all going.  Whether you make it or not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cruiser Nashville is at the perimeter of the task force. It's lookouts spot Japanese patrol boats ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The message is handed to Admiral Halsey.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, lookouts on the cruisers report patrol boats, ten miles away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Japs have set up a picket line! Order the cruisers to open fire!  We've got to sink them before they get a message away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cruiser NASHVILLE begins firing rounds at the Japanese patrol boat; round after round misses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The operators hear the excited voices of Japanese radio traffic.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They've reported our position!  Tell the Admiral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doolittle hurries up to the command bridge, with the naval officers sent by the Admiral to fetch him.  Doolittle sees the cruisers next to the carrier firing its guns -- at Japanese boats in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle finds the Admiral gathered with his staff, their mood is grim.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How far are we from Tokyo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven hundred miles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe, Danny, and the other pilots are alone at their bunks, taking advantage of the lull before the mission. Rafe has paper and pen to write a letter, but he can't think of anything to write. Danny holds the "Picture of Paradise" that Sammy took, of Evelyn and the nurses in the sun.  He tucks it inside his shirt, when he hears -- LOUDSPEAKER Army pilots, man your planes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pilots run onto deck.  The cruiser next to the Hornet is still firing away at the Japanese patrol boat. Doolittle runs onto deck, shouting orders.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Load in every bit of extra gas you can carry!  And strip everything you don't need out of the planes.  I mean
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's starting to rain but the guys don't notice at all. They're stripping seats out of the planes, tossing out their own gear. Greening pulls the machine guns out of the rear of the planes and puts in broomsticks painted black. Off in the distance the Japanese patrol boat takes a hit and explodes.  Rafe and Danny meet between their bombers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They climb into their bombers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Broomsticks instead of tail guns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll get separated over the target, but you and I will rendezvous for the run to China.  I'm on your wing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I'm on yours.  Land of the free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Home of the Brave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The engines are revving.  The tachs are showing redline.  The crews are in their planes.  Doolittle is first, just ahead of Rafe and Danny's B-25's. The battle pennants whip, the props blur, the wheels strain against the brakes; from the cockpits the flight deck looks impossibly short...and the American flag cracks in the wind. And now every pilot looks at Doolittle's plane... Doolittle starts the run down the flight deck...faster...the end looming.  He turns the plane almost vertical, standing it on its props...and lifts away smoothly. The sailors on deck cheer, like the Japanese did before Pearl Harbor. Rafe, Danny, and the others take off too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The B-25's head toward Japan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Admiral Halsey, on the deck of the ENTERPRISE, watches as the last plane takes off.  The planes recede in the distance, racing just a few feet over the water, toward Japan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The task force runs for home.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Of all the other things this mission is doing that have never been done before... I've never sent out planes that I wasn't going to see safely home.  Let's get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At first the planes are together; Rafe and Danny can see each other off each other's wing, and Doolittle's plane is ahead. The others are grouped after them.  They maintain strict radio silence, and can communicate only with gestures, hand signals, or a flasher for Morse code.  When Rafe speaks to the crew of his own plane, it's by pressing an intercom sender to his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bombardier/navigator is already working out the numbers at his plotting table in the center of the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe looks over to Danny and gives him a thumbs up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's our ETA for Tokyo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Almost exactly at 12 noon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: High n-noon.  I k-kinda like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Danny calls back to his GUNNER, who is watching the fuel supply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunner is already pouring gas into the tanks from the extra cans. Anthony stands and moves back to the rear of the plane, pulls a piece of chalk from his pocket and writes on the nose of the bombs -- "For America,"  "For Pearl Harbor,"  "For the Arizona,"  "For Billy."
direction.name: direction
