dialogue.raw_text: We got a 25-mile-an-hour head wind.  How we doing with fuel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe flies, lost in thought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is back at Pearl, struggling to keep her mind on her work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny is looking at his gauges, then at the picture in his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a pleasant day, and the people of Tokyo are in a confident, happy mood.  They're shopping, smiling, enjoying beautiful spring weather.  The Emperor is on the garden of his palace having lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The American planes are coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and his navigator confer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His copilot uses the flashes to signal the other planes. They break off for their individual targets, every plane now on it's own.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Time for the others to break off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This is the nerve center of Tokyo's defense.  An OFFICER receives a message and reports to his supervisor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Coastal stations report a low flying plane coming in off the sea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From the sea?... That couldn't be right, it must be part of the air raid practice this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The planes reach the Japanese coastline, and start skimming over treetop level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office of an anti-aircraft battery blows its whistle; his crew mount their guns and swerves them around.  The officer whistle's again and checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crew dismount their guns; just a drill.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Japanese people are unaware of the drill.  People are browsing through open-air shops, where new radios are turned on, playing music.  And Tokyo Rose is talking -- in English and Japanese.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is another beautiful day in Tokyo, as all of Japan basks in a new day of victory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coma, Danny's navigator, picks this up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These words go through the plane; and in the other planes they hear it too.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to this -- it's Tokyo Rose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our brave sailors and soldiers, inspired by our divine Emperor, have pushed the Americans from the Pacific.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But hiding at home will not save them. Each time the Americans have tasted the samurai spirit, they have learned the bitter taste of defeat, while Japan is embraced by the divine wind that has protected our island for seven centuries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The planes reach Tokyo, and flash across the rooftops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll give that bitch something to announce. Danny and Rafe give each other a wave, and divert toward their separate targets.  Each plane is on its own now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doolittle's plane flashes right over the Emperor's palace. The Emperor sits in the garden, meditating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mothers walking their children see the planes flash by overhead, and like the people at Pearl, they think they are friendlies.  A toddler points up and smiles.  His mother picks him up and hugs him happily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!  So beautiful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe's bombardier works his 20-cent bombsight, as Rafe holds the plane steady, bringing it up to 200 feet. They scan for fighter or anti-aircraft fire.  There isn't any.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Open bomb bay doors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs toward its target...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: races over Tokyo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bombardier hits the first switch.  The bomb falls toward a factory. It strikes home, right on target.  The blast is shocking -- it blows debris higher than the plane.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bomb bay doors open, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The individual planes drop their bombs, four per plane, on shipyards, factories, oil supplies, weapons facilities. Their bombing is highly accurate. On the ground, at the open-air market, for a brief moment Radio Tokyo goes silent; then -- TOKYO ROSE (ON THE RADIO) We interrupt this broadcast... Tokyo is being bombed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Emperor looks up at the sound of air raid sirens and distant explosions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Surely just a drill, Divine One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Last bomb away. It slams into a factory, blowing debris everywhere and turning the factory into an inferno. Rafe's tail gunner sees Zeros swarming in with vengeance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe changes course quickly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We got Zeros!  And they're pissed off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Anti-aircraft FLAK bursts in the sky in front of them; Danny takes evasive action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe pushes the engines to top speed and changes course again; but the B-25's can't outrun the Zeros.  Their fire chews into the bomber's tail, hitting the gunner.  Red scrambles back to find the gunner dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red reacting to bullets coming through the rear of the fuselage, looks at the brooms protruding from the rear of the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the bombardier, navigator, and Red jump onto the other machine guns, Rafe looks for a way out.  He dives down toward the city.  The Zeros follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can you get 'em off us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatta ya want me to do, sweep 'em!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe takes the B-25 right down among the buildings, sometimes even having to spin the wings to get through.  The Zeros can't keep up with this... But Rafe can't keep it up long, either; they break out into open ground rail yards, where there's no place for him to hide... The Zeros come in to chew him up... But they take fire from another B-25 -- Danny's -- coming in to save Rafe's plane.  Rafe now uses the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Danny stays, mixing it up with the Zeros; with both B-25's together, their machine guns down one Zero and damage another.  But there are too many. Rafe sees clouds coming in, and fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bombers race toward the clouds, and make it; the Zeros lose them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Danny, get the hell out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Danny, run for the clouds!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Danny keep broken contact through the clouds, and settle in for the long run to China.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We burned a lot of fuel back there. Flash them and ask about their supply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony reads the Morse code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny looks across to Rafe and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "How's your fuel?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt is at his desk when General Marshall enters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have bombed Tokyo, Mr. President. Radio Tokyo interrupted it's own broadcast to make the announcement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have the planes made it to China?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There've been some complications, Sir. The Chinese didn't receive our request for homing beacons until is was too late to get them set.  And the planes had to take off so early they may lack fuel to make the mainland anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So those brave men are flying blind and running out of fuel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Chinese are sending out search parties to try to find the crews before the Jap patrols do, if any of the planes make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God help them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They've climbed above the clouds; the fliers are exhausted. The sun is beginning to set.  Rafe stares at it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is white again -- the white of bandages and casts. Everyone is busy, and even the wounded are looking out for each other; a man with his arms in an airplane splint holds a spoon and feeds a badly burned buddy.  Evelyn and her overworked nurses are looking after the critical cases.  But as she covers the windows with blackout curtains, she stops for just a moment to stare at the sun's last rays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel Doolittle can make out mountains below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then his engines start to sputter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the plane on auto-pilot and the men move to the hatches.  Three guys go out; it's just Doolittle and his copilot left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They jump.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We'll fly till we run out of fuel, then bail out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chute!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody else is gonna make it either.  If I live through this, they're gonna put me in Leavenworth Prison.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coma moves up to Danny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny gestures across to Rafe that he hears nothing in his radio phones.  Rafe gestures the same thing back. They look down and the entire ground is covered with clouds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're running out of fuel.  And I can't find the beacon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know if we're over sea or land. Drop flares and try to spot something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They drop flares; they disappear into the cloud cover and tell them nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's engines are sputtering; his gunner pours the last drops of gas into the tanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red sees Anthony signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe yells at Danny, as if he could hear -- RAFE You are not bailing out into water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through a break in the clouds they spot a rocky shoreline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red signals; Danny's plane signals back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe looks over at Danny, who is gesturing; he gives up on the hand signals and grabs the flasher; Red reads the Morse code...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe grabs the flasher and angrily flashes back two letters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe turns his bomber and Danny follows, their planes arcing down toward the rocky coast; it's hairy, the clouds masking their view, as the altimeter winds down... At the last moment they see rocks looming out of the surf.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Flash Rafe.  We're gonna bail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've gotta jump.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not unless we know he's over land!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Coastline below!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got coast!  Signal him to climb and jump.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They don't have fuel to make altitude. He's gonna set it down in the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... G-O.  You go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !  We stay together!  I'll go in first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He's shouting to his crew -- RAFE Hang on tight!  I'll put her in the smooth water and we'll swim in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His engines are sputtering, catching, sputtering; he fights to stay in control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe's plane settles down toward the water; he guns the engine to level out, and the plane skims across the surface; then the propellers catch and the plane stops like it hit a wall, flipping over it's nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is struggling; when he tries to add throttle, the engines sputter out.  The plane drops, skips once on the surface, then hits a shoreline rock belly first. Danny and Anthony are ejected through the top of the fuselage; Coma is hurled forward right through the glass nose of the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe and Red come to in the plane inverted and sinking.  They react, unbuckling, grabbing for their crewmates as the plane is quickly filling.  The navigator and gunner are unconscious; the bombardier is dead.  Red struggles with the hatch and can't make it budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They struggle to breath as the water envelops them.  But as the water reaches the top, Rafe takes a last breath and dives to the hatch; it comes open, and they swim up, dragging the rest of the crew.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It won't open til the plane fills!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They break the surface, and struggle to shore with the unconscious navigator and gunner. Rafe's looking everywhere; he sees Danny's plane crashed against the rock.  He fights his way through the surf to Danny's plane, Red following. Rafe finds Danny face up in the water. Red finds Anthony on the rock.  He's face up, but as Red lifts him he finds the back of Anthony's head is gone. The rest of Danny's crew are floating in the surf, dead. Rafe and Red pull Danny to shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's eyes flutter open; he sees Rafe and mumbles -- DANNY I've made better landings. Danny's hand gropes to his throat; Rafe finds a V shaped shard of the fuselage hooked into his neck. Rafe grabs it, trying to bend it open; the sharp metal cuts his hands, but he keeps straining.  It won't work, He pulls his .45 from his jacket and tries to pry the metal.  It works a bit; he tosses the pistol aside and grabs the shard again, and opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe's head snaps forward, crunched with the butt of a rifle; a Japanese patrol, four men, have arrived.  They're angry, scared, hyped.  They knock Red down too, yelling and brandishing their rifles at the fliers on the beach, living and dead. The Japanese officer is barking orders.  They find the Captain's insignia on Danny's jacket, and begin binding him to a yoke, his wrists tied to the wood like a crucifixion, a wire around his neck.  They find the navigator unconscious, but alive.  The officer snaps a single word and a soldier shoots the navigator. The others wire Rafe's ankles together... Rafe is emotionless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Danny!  DANNY!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You hang on, Danny!  You hang on!  You're gonna make it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: fades in and out.  He hears Danny choking, and his mind sees Danny as a boy those long years ago, being carried by the neck across the field by his father... Then Rafe sees THE PRESENT:  Danny being half-carried, half- dragged by the neck by two Japanese.  The officer is pulling Red along, hands bound behind him.  And Rafe starts moving, being dragged on his back, pulled by his feet along the rocky sand. His hand slides by the pistol he tossed behind the rock. The whole world slows down. He clutches it, shoots one of the men towing Danny.  And as the man dragging Rafe turns around, Rafe shoots him in the face. The officer spins, raising his rifle; the soldier pulling Red, shoves him onto his face in the sand and aims his rifle too.  The officer is pulling the trigger to kill Rafe when Danny slams him down from behind. The fourth soldier shoots Danny in the gut, then takes aim for Rafe's heart -- and is shot through the chest from behind. The Japanese officers rises in surprise and is cut down by scythes carried by the Chinese peasant soldiers who are just arriving. Rafe struggles to Danny, moving the Chinese aside.  Danny lies on his back, clutching his wound as if to hold onto his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Danny is silent, his eyes drifting shut, and in that moment Rafe thinks he is gone already.  Then Danny's eyes drift open, finding him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The words almost kill Rafe, filling him with grief.  From somewhere he finds the strength to say -- RAFE I will.  And your baby. (beat) You're gonna be a father. Did Danny hear?  His eyes are closed again.  But his head comes up; Rafe takes it, and Danny pulls him closer to whisper -- DANNY No.  You are. Rafe cradles Danny in his arms.  Danny's eyes are open, but Rafe sees no light there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Danny will never answer him again.  Rafe hugs Danny tight, and weeps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Danny...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take care of Evelyn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Danny... Land of the free... Land of the free...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  VARIOUS SHOTS - DAY The news of the raid hits Washington...and the rest of America.  If it isn't wild celebration; when people see the headline:  AIR RAID ON TOKYO, and DOOLITTLE DOES MUCH; their faces change, as if finally told what they already knew -- that America would prevail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the ceremony at the White House, as Roosevelt presents Doolittle with the metal.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Doolittle Raid was the pivotal moment of America's war with Japan.  Before it, America knew nothing but defeat; after it, nothing but victory. (beat) One crew of Doolittle's raiders made it to Vladivostok, Russia, where they were interred for much of the war.  Thirteen planes crash landed in China, where the Chinese people helped the Americans escape, and had their villages destroyed and citizens executed by the Japanese forces of occupation.  Two crews were captured by the Japanese and three fliers were executed without trial, called "war criminals" by the Japanese.  Jimmy Doolittle was promoted to General, and given the medal of honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Out by the crop dusting landing field is a memorial to Danny Walker, with an American flag flying high above it.  Standing at the memorial are Rafe and Evelyn.  Rafe holds a child in his arms, a boy, named Danny.
direction.name: direction
